descriptions.overview: These heavy-duty mailbox mounting brackets are constructed from galvanized steel. These versatile Metal Mounting Brackets incorporate a universal design that permits installation on any Gibraltar 4Ã—4 wood post. Ideal for mounting medium-sized, large and extra-large mailboxes to the post, they are made from heavy-duty galvanized steel to reduce the potential for rusting. Mailbox mounting hardware is also provided.
list: Adjusts to fit most US approved rural mailboxes

reviews.title: "Keeping it simple"
reviews.text: This is a basic mounting bracket meant for cross-arm mounting.  Each of two metal supports is fastened with one wood screw to the cross-arm.  This is done twice, providing support for the rear and the front of the mailbox being mounted.  There are four fastening nut/bolt combinations which are the used to fasten the mailbox to the metal supports.  The metal supports are pre-drilled with multiple holes to enable different width mailboxes and the overall arrangement seems very sturdy.  I gave only 4 stars because I would have liked another pre-drilled hole to accommodate a slightly wider mailbox (like the one I mounted); also, it would be nice if there were lock washers for the nut/bolt combinations.  Overall, a solid product.
reviews.author: RickO

reviews.title: "Not for the large mailboxes."
reviews.text: I have a large country mailbox. It fit with the brackets at their widest installation, however the mailbox is too heavy and bent the brackets. I would need to use as many brackets as there are whiles in my mailbox for mounting. Easy to install, but only for smaller size mailboxes.
reviews.author: Doityourself

reviews.title: "Worthless"
reviews.text: First, I had to drill additional holes to make the parts match the width of the mailbox.  Second, the bracket is so flimsy that they bent when I opened the mailbox door.  I had to go buy lumber to create a solid support.
reviews.author: Daddybob

reviews.title: "Easy install"
reviews.text: Very easy to install and no cutting a board to fit the bottom of your mail box. only reason for 4 stars is I am waiting to see how sturdy they are against a snow plow.
reviews.author: v45honda

reviews.title: "Too flimsy"
reviews.text: We bought this bracket when we had to replace our mailbox and post. The bracket doesn't hold the mailbox as well as we had hoped. I suspect it will need to be replaced after a couple years with something more sturdy.
reviews.author: fotojedi

reviews.title: "Too weak"
reviews.text: Everything fit well, but the brackets were too weak. Opening the mailbox caused enough strain on the brackets to make them bend and cause the mailbox to lean forward.
reviews.author: Tim

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Warren

reviews.title: "Amazing"
reviews.text: I absolutely loved these.  They are so simple and universal.  It was seriously the nicest easiest  part to install on what was a sad job to do. Since the mailbox of 5 yrs decided to jump behind my car. I had to replace the whole thing while listening to five youngsters giving me crap about taking out ole faithful.  It was so simple it actually gave me relief to make the process that much faster and did I mention easier.
reviews.author: Don

reviews.title: "Mailbox mount brackets"
reviews.text: Used with replacement mailbox.  Took a little adjustment to get the flat tip screw and nut to tighten up.  Small space under mailbox, so small needle nose pliers to hold nut down for tightness.  Also the screw is standard tip and an odd smaller size FYI if you are attaching to a crossbar post,  depending on size of box, you may need 2 of these kits
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "ajustable width bracket"
reviews.text: This adjustable bracket is screwed onto the post & the lugs on the ends are easily nut & bolted onto the mail box with the hard ware enclose with the brackets
reviews.author: Boo

reviews.title: "Great product, easy to install."
reviews.text: This was around $5 vs the fancy kind for almost $20. I like this because it is low profile, cost effective, and easy to install. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.author: Kelley

reviews.title: "For mailbox bracket"
reviews.text: The brackets recommended for the mailbox are great! Couldn't install the box without them!
reviews.author: Vonnie

reviews.title: "Easy"
reviews.text: Great product.  Easy to install.  I had my mailbox up in no time at all. (Less than 20 minutes.)
reviews.author: Jon

reviews.title: "Mounting Bracket"
reviews.text: A SIMPLE DESIGNED PRODUCT,BET VERY VERSATILE. EASY TO INSTALL WITH ANY DESIGNED MAIL BOX.
reviews.author: Dick

reviews.title: "Mailbox Bracket"
reviews.text: These are easy to use and come with everything you need to mount a mailbox to a post.
reviews.author: MIKE

reviews.title: "Mailbox brackets"
reviews.text: These brackets made the installation of our new mailbox and post assembly very easy.
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "Worked Perfectly"
reviews.text: The mounting bracket was easy to install and worked perfectly.
reviews.author: Sarah

reviews.title: "Garbage"
reviews.text: Did not do what it was promised.  I ended up throwing away.
reviews.author: Richard

questions.question: "can this be used to mount mailbox to arm?"
questions.author: Tim

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. We have two mounting brackets that you can use to put on the crossarm to mount the mailbox. We have UMB universal mounting bracket that is metal and PLMB that is plastic

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. Postmaster is just a brand. By chance do you have the name of the mailbox. A cedar post should work with most of our mailboxes unless it is like our Jumbo. In that case you need to make your own mounting board

answers.author: Jennifer B
answers.text: Hi there--the flag itself requires holes to be drilled into the mailbox. Since it is a replacement flag the holes should already be present and you just screw it in place. Hope this helps!

questions.question: "What are the minimum and maximum widths this can accommodate?"
questions.author: Anonymous
